attributes.action: to investigate why single people who are in full time employment, own houses, pay bills and are without children are not entitled to any support from the government in the form of reduced rates apart from council tax, which at present is only 25%.  We are now in a serious credit crunch and find it difficult to survive and as a result of this are having to sell our homes and move back with their parents!  Is there a possibility of having a single persons benefit????
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Being 1 is more expensive than being 2.
It is impossible for 1 person on an average income to consider buying their home. 
It costs as much to heat and service a home for 1 as it does for 2. 
It costs more to make 2 meals for 1 than to make 1 meal for 2. 
Water rates cost the same for 1 as for 2. 
1 person pays 25% more council tax than each half of a couple.
The demands on infrastructure from 1 is less than those made by 2. 1 person still has to pay tax for schools, buses, and other child-oriented services which they never use.
However, single people are penalised by discriminatory taxes. eg. they can't pass on their pensions to anyone. There is no special case for inheritance but couples get EXTRA tax allowances. 
Single people should at least be living on a level playing field where every person is treated the same way - as an individual
